column4: Russia's Uralkali eyes potash distributors on key markets - paper
column5: MOSCOW  Aug 26 Russian potash producer Uralkali   which has pulled out of a trading venture with its Belarusian partner  is in talks to buy distributors on key markets to maximise sales  the Vedomosti newspaper reported on Monday.

column4: Wales Open heralds start of European Ryder Cup race
column5: The year-long quest to win a place in Europe's 2014 Ryder Cup team starts at this week's Wales Open and captain Paul McGinley cannot wait for the qualifying process to begin.

column4: Sanofi trial shows Fluzone high-dose flu vaccine efficacy
column5: PARIS Sanofi said on Monday that a large clinical trial showed its Fluzone High-Dose vaccine to be more effective at preventing influenza in adults aged 65 and older than a standard dose of Fluzone.

column4: Third Point increases stake in Sotheby's to 5.7 pct - filing
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 26 Activist investor Daniel Loeb's hedge fund Third Point LLC increased its stake in Sotheby's  to 5.7 percent of the auction house's shares  a regulatory filing showed on Monday.

column4: Analysis: Spending on cars  homes threatens apparel sales as holidays approach
column5: Even with consumer confidence at a six-year high  retailers ranging from Target Corp  to Macy's Inc  are competing not only with each other but are also having to adapt to shifting spending patterns.

column4: New apps help shoppers identify items using image recognition
column5: TORONTO  Aug 26 A new app lets shoppers flipping through retail flyers purchase items that catch their eye using image recognition technology.

column4: Telefonica wins Slim over with sweetened German deal
column5: AMSTERDAM/MADRID Telefonica has raised its bid for KPN's German arm by 6 percent to 8.55 billion euros ($11.5 billion)  winning over top KPN investor America Movil and setting the stage for consolidation in Europe's largest mobile market.

column4: Exclusive: United Tech  Pentagon in $1 billion-plus deal for F-35 engines
column5: WASHINGTON Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp  has reached an agreement in principle with the Pentagon on a contract to build 39 engines for a sixth batch of F-35 Joint Strike Fighters  three sources familiar with the deal said on Monday.

column4: United Tech  US reach $1 bln-plus deal for F-35 engines -sources
column5: WASHINGTON  Aug 26 Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp has reached agreement in principle with the Pentagon on a contract to build 39 engines for a sixth batch of F-35 Joint Strike Fighters  three sources familiar with the deal said Monday.

column4: Sinopec says no firm plan to set up oil service JV with Weatherford
column5: HONG KONG  Aug 26 Asia's largest refiner Sinopec Corp said on Monday it has no firm plan to set up an oil service joint venture with U.S. listed Weatherford International  although it has been looking at the potential of entering tie-ups in that field.
